Community Palliative Care Nurse

Company Name Barwon Health Company Location Geelong, AU

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 4 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Enjoy a role where you will be an active part of a health care team shows leadership and embraces change
  • Ongoing training and professional development in a supported work environment
  • Join our world class and innovation-led organisation today


About The Facility

Guided by our values Barwon Health is Victoria's largest regional health care service and is also the largest employer in the Geelong and surf coast region, employing over 6,500 staff. Working at Barwon Health offers diversity where no two days are the same with varied areas of expertise and locations. We have a dedicated education and training department giving you access to opportunities to improve your knowledge and skill base.

About The Role

In your role, you will report to the Community Palliative Care Clinical Nurse Consultant and are responsible for providing advanced and senior palliative care clinical practice to people utilising acute-based services primarily in the non-malignant areas of healthcare. You will work within an interdisciplinary team context, and across the palliative care program in all acute settings. You will enhance the team’s capacity to work in shared care situations while also providing clinical leadership, education and support to palliative care colleagues, and generalist and/or other specialty staff. The Community Palliative Care program operates Monday to Sunday with nursing staff working a rotating roster of 8 hour shifts which includes weekends.

About The Culture

Our staff thrive in a challenging environment, get enjoyment from being part of a highly recognised and skilled team and truly believe they have the opportunities to be their best. Most importantly our dedicated staff live the Barwon Health way with our values under pinning all that we do.

Barwon Health Staff Benefits
  • Flexible working arrangements
  • Professional development
  • Access to employee wellness facility
  • Salary packaging
  • Social club
  • Be our future Barwon Health Strategic Plan
  • Aboriginal Employment Plan
  • Our Commitment to Child Safety

At Barwon Health we celebrate and harness diversity, and consider it a competitive advantage. We encourage applications from all diverse backgrounds including individuals that identify as Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders, GLBTIQ+, and individuals with disability. Our organisation promotes the safety, wellbeing and inclusion of all our consumers including children and appropriate rigorous reference and background checks will be undertaken. Barwon Health is proud to be Totally Smoke Free.

Seniority Level

Associate

Industry

  • Nonprofit Organization Management
  • Health, Wellness and Fitness
  • Hospital & Health Care

Full-time

867405113:
[

Cyber Security Consultant

Company Name Context Information Security Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 5 hours ago Number of views 6 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Our clients look to us to provide solutions to their most complex information security challenges, in order to protect their most critical resources. Our clients trust us with this great responsibility because of the quality of our people; leaders in their field, inquisitive and capable of rising to the most complex of challenges.


We are currently looking for a Cyber Security Consultant who is ready to take on the challenge of helping our clients with their security journey. The core purpose of this service line is to help organisations to effectively measure and mitigate their cyber risks across their people, processes and technology in a repeatable way. You will devise, articulate and deliver solutions that solve the most complicated of challenges for our clients. This will often involve working closely with multi-disciplinary teams across other parts of Context’s business to include Response, Assurance, Research, Sales and Marketing.


We are looking for someone with a sharp intellect, strong communication skills and business acumen within the field of cyber security and risk management who would like to help us build upon our leading cyber advisory capability.


Responsibilities\xa0


  • Formulating, developing and delivering cyber advisory service lines in collaboration with colleagues in other parts of the business, including playing an important role in business development activity;
  • Building and developing long term relationships with senior stakeholders across the market including with existing client organisations;
  • Leading in the formulation and production of thought-leadership and industry research into cyber defence, threat intelligence, crisis and response management to cyber issues;
  • Representing the organisation at industry events and presenting at conferences;
  • Keeping abreast of current and emerging cyber threats, relevant legislation, regulation and risk management frameworks;
  • Maintaining relevant industry and government certifications.

Person Specification\xa0


  • Demonstrable breadth and depth of cyber security understanding and experience;
  • Adaptable and versatile communication range, comfortable from the board room to the SOC; able to translate from business needs into technical and vice versa;
  • Knowledge and expertise in one of the key target industry sectors;
  • Conversant with multiple relevant policy and regulatory requirements/ frameworks;
  • Ability to clearly and concisely articulate the cyber challenges associated with emerging themes in technology transformation and innovation;
  • Demonstrable experience delivering advisory services to one or more industry sectors, such as governance and risk management gap analysis and workshops; incident readiness table top exercises; cyber capability maturity assessments etc.
  • Ability to operate within and navigate through complex environments;
  • Critical thinking and creativity to discern multiple alternative outcomes and solutions;
  • Ability to hold an Australian security clearance highly beneficial;

866968941:
[

Associates or Senior Associates, Corporate M&A and Capital Markets (Melbourne)

Company Name Allens Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 13 hours ago Number of views 15 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

About Allens\xa0\xa0


Allens is an international law firm with offices throughout Australia and Asia. Through an integrated alliance with Linklaters, we offer clients access to an extensive network comprising 40 offices in 28 countries. Allens offers one of the most comprehensive legal networks in Australia and Asia.


We have been named Australian Law Firm of the Year in the Chambers Asia-Pacific Awards 2017 thanks to positive feedback from our clients. The award caps off a year of working with clients on some of Australia's largest and most complex deals.


The opportunity\xa0


Our Mergers and Acquisitions (M&A) and Capital Markets Team has advised on many of Australia's largest M&A transactions in recent years, demonstrating our team's strength as one of the leading corporate practices in Australia. \xa0We are pleased to have played a crucial role in the largest and most complex deals in Australia's corporate history. \xa0With an emphasis on quality, innovation and timeliness, we deliver highly successful outcomes in M&A for leading companies and financial sponsors in Australia and around the world.\xa0


Following a very busy and successful year for our M&A and Capital Markets practice nationally, we are now seeking to employ talented Associates or Senior Associates to join our growing Melbourne team.\xa0


Working alongside a number of Partners in the practice, you will be involved in public and private M&A and corporate advisory work.\xa0 You will also have the opportunity to work on capital raisings and for private equity clients.\xa0 You will gain exposure across a broad range of sectors including mining, infrastructure, energy, financial services, health, media, technology and retail.\xa0


What you'll bring


To succeed in this role you will need



  • Experience from a Corporate / M&A practice ideally at a leading Australian practice or international firm.

  • An ability to effectively manage smaller matters and discrete elements of larger matters.

  • A desire and ability to grow, both as a lawyer and leader.

  • A willingness to build an understanding of clients and develop effective working relationships.

  • An ability to establish a professional profile and internal networks.

  • A willingness to develop others through mentoring and sharing experiences and networks.


What we'll offer


At Allens, we’re focused on advancing our industry through equipping our people with the skills and experience they need to be the lawyers of the future. We’re ready to define tomorrow. Are you?


With us, you’ll be more than a lawyer. Our people are technical experts, but they’re also trusted business advisers who think bigger, more broadly and more strategically. Together, we solve complex legal challenges, and collaborate across practice areas and disciplines to guide our clients.


We work across borders too, thanks to our alliance with Linklaters. This strategic partnership opens up worlds of opportunity for our business and our people, including rotations in Linklaters London, Hong Kong and Singapore for our graduate lawyers.


In a rapidly changing world, we seek opportunities to innovate, embracing creative thinking, new approaches and emerging technology. And we don’t just use them to benefit ourselves and our clients. We believe strongly in driving positive change to do right by our community too.


Our teams are open, inclusive and encouraging, giving you the chance to learn and grow, but your development will be down to you. You’ll have the flexibility to drive your career, and we’ll recognise your achievements and hard work as you progress through the firm. Are you ready to begin?


How to apply


We prefer to hear from you directly. Please submit your application via our on-line careers site addressed to Rachael Duggan, Resourcing Manager or call Rachael on +61 2 9230 4618 for a confidential discussion.


#LinkedIn



Advertised 10 Sep 2018 AUS Eastern Standard Time
Applications close

Industry

  • Law Practice

Employment Type

Full-time

Job Functions

  • Legal

The Systems Trainer, reporting to the Information Systems Training & Communications Manager, is responsible for managing and delivering training and induction sessions for RPV's core information management systems and portable devices. Sales Operations Analyst - Multiple 12 month Contracts - Sydney, Brisbane and Melbourne

Company Name Nutanix Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 32 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Sales Operations Analyst\xa0

As the first Sales Operations Analyst, you will be responsible for supporting the Nutanix Sales Operations team scale and meet the needs of the sales team in the ANZ region. This is a contract role for min 12 months with a view to go permanent. We also have multiple roles.\xa0

Responsibilities include but not limited to:

Responsibilities:
• Work with the regional leaders to drive forecasting and pipeline management.
• Work with the sales teams to get the orders into order management in a timely manner
• Work closely with other functional groups to resolve any orders/shipments issues
• Support Finance and Sales Operations in resolving problems pertaining to sales orders and customer issues.
• With direction from the regional leaders work with regional partners and distributors to help them with onboarding
• Acknowledge/provide feedback to internal & external customers on order status
• Support the manager in training end users on Nutanix systems and business processes
• Respond to Ad hoc requests regarding reports, processes, adhoc requests etc.
• Design and implement new business processes relating the sales organization
• Work closely with the sales team to help manage the SFDC hygiene
• Help manage and administer different systems used by the sales team
• Design and build reports for reps and managers

Required Skills/Experience:
• Bachelors degree from accredited university preferred
• Strong Salesforce.com experience preferred ex: be able to create dashboards, reports.
• Solid computer skills required, Salesforce.com, Clari, MS Excel, MS PowerPoint, Outlook.
• 3+ years experience in sales operations preferred, data quality, customer service, order management.
• Strong customer service focus, written and verbal communication skills, and attention to detail and accuracy.
• Ability to take initiative, work flexibly, and adhere to priorities with minimal direct supervision.
• Familiarity with administrative and reporting functions within Salesforce.com CRM.
• Strong problem solving and analytical skills
• Demonstrated ability to drive process improvements, problem-solve, and produce results.
• Strong Skills in various ERP systems needed with understanding of process flows and interactions with peer teams (Finance, Sales, etc.)

Job description

Employee Experience Support Specialist
Glen Waverley - Melbourne

Who are we?

We are a tech company that exists to make business life easier. Our team is continually growing, inventing and disrupting conventions. We believe business can do amazing things and it’s our job to help them. This is MYOB.

You’ll be part of an award-winning Employee Experience (EE) team who are masters in providing world-class technical, commercial and talent support. Together, we enable everyone at MYOB to carry out the company’s vision of helping businesses succeed.

The opportunity

This is an exciting opportunity for a motivated and passionate individual looking for experience in a tech company that could lead to further development and career opportunities. Reporting to the Head of Workplace Experience, and working with a high performing team, you will see yourself looking to improve the current approach in some areas of the role as well as helping us to consider completely new, creative and innovative approaches in other areas of the role.

This is an important hands-on role where you will proactively support the broader EE team to deliver outstanding experiences for our people particularly in the areas of workplace and digital experience as well as onboarding new starters and supporting office based organisational development initiatives and events.

You will be one of the first points of contact within the EE division, providing first level support and guidance to employees for EE related activities, connecting employees with relevant EE teams when more specialised support is required. You will have an unwavering passion to make a positive impact on people’s working lives, and thrive in an environment where plans are ambitious.

What You Will Bring
  • Experience working in a support, customer service or helpdesk position
  • Amazing customer service skills
  • A genuine passion for technology and innovation
  • A keen problem solver who loves to share their knowledge
  • A natural curiosity and interest in challenging the status quo and finding new and better ways of delivering value
  • Tenacity and resilience
  • Prior experience in Technology or Professional Services is well regarded
  • You love what you do and love to share your knowledge within your workplace and team
What else do you need to know?

You will be part of an energetic and inspiring team delivering value to our ever-evolving business. You will have access to some fantastic professional and personal learning and development opportunities. We support flexibility and are willing to discuss flexible options to attract the best candidate.

If you love what you do and are great at it, then we want to hear from you. We look forward to meeting you.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company.
